channel.title: Parth Parikh's Blog
channel.description: Explore the exciting world of Computer Science with me! From the depths of Data Structures and Algorithms to the cutting-edge advancements in NLP and Databases, my blog delves into a wide range of topics to keep you informed and inspired.

item.title: IBM 305 RAMAC and the 1960 Winter Olympics
item.description: In this blog post, we will explore the IBM 305 RAMAC and its use in the 1960 Winter Olympics.

item.title: One Billion Row Challenge in Rust
item.description: In this blog post, we will tackle the One Billion Row Challenge using Rust and Python, converging on a solution in under 10 seconds and looking into some exciting optimizations at play.

item.title: Roaring Bitmaps
item.description: In this blog post, we explore Bitmap indexes and their compression techniques, emphasizing their use in databases. We take a look at data structures like Run Length Encoding, Byte-Aligned Bitmap Code, Word-Aligned Hybrid Code, Concise, and Roaring Bitmaps.

item.title: Tangoing with a Martin Gardner Word Game
item.description: In this blog post, we explore a 1969 word game from Martin Gardner. We dive into its computational solving strategies, highlighting the complexity and fun of this NYT-esque puzzle.

item.title: Scrambling Eggs for Spotify with Knuth's Fibonacci Hashing
item.description: In this blog post, we explore Spotify's journey from using the Fisher-Yates shuffle to a more sophisticated song shuffling algorithm that prevents clustering of tracks by the same artist. We then connect this challenge to Fibonacci hashing, and propose a novel, evenly distributed artist shuffling method.
